Any advice for someone trying to learn backgrounds and building study architecture?
Who yes, I do have some tips there.

Just a second?
Um?
So if you're doing architecturally focused backgrounds like cityscapes and stuff, I would really work on your perspective grids.
2.3 point perspective.
Move the camera around in really push yourself like do you know.
Kind of like a bird's eye view or Batman view from the top of the building looking down.
Really push yourself on, you know where your positioning that camera and that perspective grid an repeat that.
Just until you can do it from memory and you can kind of see the grid without having to draw it out.
That's kind of what I did with when I was trying to push composition.
I would draw my grids out an place all my characters you know at the certain points that I wanted them to be, but I started every single drawing out by drawing that grid so I could look at a page.
Now an pretty much you know, see exactly where the lines would be in the proportions would be and.
Hum.
